subject: Technology
title: Retina Display and Screen Technology
description: A micro-lesson that makes Retina Display and Screen Technology usable.

hook.text: Apple claimed its Retina display packed so many pixels that your eye could not see individual dots.

buildup.text: Early phone screens were blurry and low-resolution. Text looked jagged and photos looked grainy.

discovery.text: Retina displays doubled the pixel count. At normal viewing distance, the image appeared perfectly smooth.

twist.text: Competitors quickly surpassed Apple's pixel density. A spec race began that most humans cannot perceive.

climax.text: Modern OLED screens produce deeper blacks and richer colors than any screen technology before them.

punchline.text: Phone screens are now better than most living room TVs.

quiz.question: What was special about Apple's Retina display?
options: It was the largest phone screen
Pixels were too dense for the eye to distinguish
